thread.title: Seattle Seahawks-Carolina Panthers referee: Terry McAulay
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks-Carolina Panthers referee: Terry McAulay | The Seattle Times

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks-Carolina Panthers referee: Terry McAulay
text:
The referee for the Seattle Seahawks-Carolina Panthers game is Terry McAulay, according to FootballZebras.com .
And his presence can hardly be a better omen for the Seahawks as McAulay has overseen some of Seattle’s biggest wins in recent years, including the Super Bowl victory over Denver.
McAulay also reffed Seattle’s divisional playoff game win over Carolina last year (which is interesting in light of Ron Rivera’s comments this week about Kam Chancellor’s leaps over the line of scrimmage on field goal attempts) as well as the divisional playoff win over the Saints in 2014 (the game when Percy Harvin suffered a concussion).
The Seahawks remain one of the least-penalized teams in the NFL with 33 for 321 yards, tied for sixth-fewest. Seattle’s opponents also remain lightly flagged with just 27 for 192 yards.

Bob Condotta : 206-515-5699 or bcondotta@seattletimes.com ; on Twitter: @bobcondotta . Bob Condotta covers the Seahawks for the Seattle Times. He provides daily coverage of the team throughout the year.
